intro: Inversodicraea laciniata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed evergreen, is a unique plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in spring. Its growth habit is shrub-like, with multiple stems that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Inversodicraea laciniata is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
